required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: PD-1 Antibody and Lenvatinib Plus TACE on Downstaging BCLC B/C HCC
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy and Safety of PD-1 Antibody and Lenvatinib Plus TACE on Downstaging Hepatocellular Carcinoma With BCLC B/C

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the difference of safety and efficacy about PD-1 Antibody and Lenvatinib Plus transcatheter arterial chemoembolization (TACE) on downstaging hepatocellular carcinoma with BCLC B/C.

primary_outcome.description: Resction rate refers to the proportion of patients who can receive radical surgery after downstaging treatment.

secondary_outcome.description: Postoperative adverse events (safety ) will be evaluated according to the NCI CTCAE Version 4.03.The number and severity of treatment-related side effects, including AE and SAE, will be recorded during treatment.
The duration from the date of recruitment to the date of death from any cause.
ORR is defined as the percentage of participants who have a confirmed complete response or partial response according to RECIST 1.1 or mRECIST.
PFS is defined as the time from enrollment of the trial to the first documented disease progression or death due to any cause.

arm_group.description: PD-1 Antibody and Lenvatinib Plus TACE

intervention.description: PD-1 Antibody and Lenvatinib Plus Transarterial chemoembolization(TACE )： Patients were recommended to receive TACE once every 6 weeks. Patients were recommended to begin oral administration of Lenvatinib 3 days after the first TACE treatment, and meanwhile to start intravenous drip of PD-1 antibody 3 days after the first TACE treatment, once every 3 weeks.

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Surgery, Huashan Hospital, Fudan University
